remarks: Convert between three-quantifier and four-quantifier versions of the Cauchy criterion.  (In particular, the four-quantifier version has no occurrence of ` j ` in the assertion, so it can be used with ~ rexanuz and friends.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Feb-2014.)
statement:
cau3.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
cau3 $p |- ( A. x e. RR+ E. j e. Z A. k e. ( ZZ>= ` j ) ( ( F ` k ) e. CC /\ ( abs ` ( ( F ` k ) - ( F ` j ) ) ) < x ) <-> A. x e. RR+ E. j e. Z A. k e. ( ZZ>= ` j ) ( ( F ` k ) e. CC /\ A. m e. ( ZZ>= ` k ) ( abs ` ( ( F ` k ) - ( F ` m ) ) ) < x ) ) $.
$d F j k m x $.
$d M j k x $.
$d Z j k x $.
